intro: Symplocos khasiana, commonly known as Khasi stonecrop, is a shrub native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. Its flowers are typically white or pink, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Symplocos khasiana is adapted to rocky and mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments.
